Description: Foot of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; flaing trumpet foot with broad resting surface; painted red and black petals or whirligig on floor; exterior: foot glazed with two narrow reserved lines, not clearly intentional, at join with body; underside of floor reserved with dilute band at edge; inside of foot black; resting surface reserved with dilutes bands framing three black lines; votive inscription to Aphrodite cut on outer edge of resting surface.
Curator's comments: The shape of the foot is almost identical to that of a Siana/Lip cup of 555-550 signed by Hermogenes as potter in London, BM GR 1836,0224.260 (Brijder 2000, p. 624).
Bibliographic references: Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (pp. 624, 694, no. 602)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 66, no. 820, pl. XXI, no. 820)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 689, no. 469)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1328)
